GetListValues.name: GetListValues
GetListValues.description: Returns the list values from the current combo box.

SetListValues.name: SetListValues
SetListValues.description: Sets the list values to the current combo box.

SelectListValue.name: SelectListValue
SelectListValue.description: Selects the specified value from the combo box list values.

params.name: sValue
params.description: The combo box list value that will be selected.

SetText.name: SetText
SetText.description: Sets the text to the current combo box. Available only for editable combo box forms.

IsEditable.name: IsEditable
IsEditable.description: Checks if the combo box text can be edited. If it is not editable, then this form is a dropdown list.

GetClassType.name: GetClassType
GetClassType.description: Returns a type of the ApiFormBase class.

GetFormType.name: GetFormType
GetFormType.description: Returns a type of the current form.

SetFormKey.name: SetFormKey
SetFormKey.description: Sets a key to the current form.

GetTipText.name: GetTipText
GetTipText.description: Returns the tip text of the current form.

SetTipText.name: SetTipText
SetTipText.description: Sets the tip text to the current form.

IsRequired.name: IsRequired
IsRequired.description: Checks if the current form is required.

SetRequired.name: SetRequired
SetRequired.description: Specifies if the current form should be required.

params.name: bRequired
params.description: Defines if the current form is required (true) or not (false).

IsFixed.name: IsFixed
IsFixed.description: Checks if the current form is fixed size.

ToFixed.name: ToFixed
ToFixed.description: Converts the current form to a fixed size form.

params.name: nWidth
params.description: The wrapper shape width measured in twentieths of a point (1/1440 of an inch).

params.name: nHeight
params.description: The wrapper shape height measured in twentieths of a point (1/1440 of an inch).

ToInline.name: ToInline
ToInline.description: Converts the current form to an inline form. Picture form can't be converted to an inline form, it's always a fixed size object.

SetBorderColor.name: SetBorderColor
SetBorderColor.description: Sets the border color to the current form.

params.name: bNone
params.description: Defines that border color will not be set.

SetBackgroundColor.name: SetBackgroundColor
SetBackgroundColor.description: Sets the background color to the current form.

params.name: bNone
params.description: Defines that background color will not be set.

GetText.name: GetText
GetText.description: Returns the text from the current form. This method is used only for text and combo box forms.

GetWrapperShape.name: GetWrapperShape
GetWrapperShape.description: Returns a shape in which the form is placed to control the position and size of the fixed size form frame. The null value will be returned for the inline forms.

SetPlaceholderText.name: SetPlaceholderText
SetPlaceholderText.description: Sets the placeholder text to the current form. Can't be set to checkbox or radio button.

params.name: sText
params.description: The text that will be set to the current form.

SetTextPr.name: SetTextPr
SetTextPr.description: Sets the text properties to the current form. This method is used only for text and combo box forms.

params.name: oTextPr
params.description: The text properties that will be set to the current form.

GetTextPr.name: GetTextPr
GetTextPr.description: Returns the text properties from the current form. This method is used only for text and combo box forms.

Copy.name: Copy
Copy.description: Copies the current form (copies with the shape if it exists).

comment:
/**
	 * Class representing a document combo box / dropdown list.
	 * @constructor
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE", "CFE"]
	 * @property {boolean} editable - Specifies if the combo box text can be edited.
	 * @property {boolean} autoFit - Specifies if the combo box form content should be autofit, i.e. whether the font size adjusts to the size of the fixed size form.
	 * @property {Array.<string | Array.<string>>} items - The combo box items.
     * This array consists of strings or arrays of two strings where the first string is the displayed value and the second one is its meaning.
     * If the array consists of single strings, then the displayed value and its meaning are the same.
     * Example: ["First", ["Second", "2"], ["Third", "3"], "Fourth"].
	 * @extends {ApiFormBase}
	 */
description: Class representing a document combo box / dropdown list.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Specifies if the combo box text can be edited.

properties.name: autoFit
properties.description: Specifies if the combo box form content should be autofit, i.e. whether the font size adjusts to the size of the fixed size form.

properties.name: items
properties.description: The combo box items. This array consists of strings or arrays of two strings where the first string is the displayed value and the second one is its meaning. If the array consists of single strings, then the displayed value and its meaning are the same. Example: ["First", ["Second", "2"], ["Third", "3"], "Fourth"].
